item.description:
A light "hike" of sorts any of our members could enjoy!... The 31st annual Walking Tour of the Cheney Brothers National Historic Landmark District will launch from in front of Cheney Hall in Manchester, CT. The tour is co-sponsored by the Manchester Historical Society and MCC's Institute of Local History. For thirty years the tour was led by History Professor Emeritus John Sutherland often aided by Geography Professor Emeritus Tom Lewis. Last year John passed that torch on to Chris Paulin, the current Director of the Institute of Local History at MCC. The Walking Tour will only be postponed due to heavy rain. If this occurs it will run on Sunday, July 13, at 1:00 PM. This tour is FREE and open to the public. I guarantee you will get your money's worth (gas not included)! Dress for the weather and wear comfortable shoes and a hat.

The tour will consist of the mill area and parts of the west side of Manchester. It will take about 1.5 hours. Parking is available in the Cheney Hall parking lot (177 Hartford Rd., Manchester, CT).

Location/directions to approximate meetup location:
http://www.mapquest.c....

Cheney Brothers National Historic Landmark District:
http://www.manchester...

Cheney Hall:
(Historical) http://www.manchester...
(Events/shows) http://www.cheneyhall...
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be there... look for the 6'2" blondish guy...
